text.text_translated:
Scientists have more questions about how genes affect the brain and language.  
Are there genes that mutated and gave us the ability to speak?  
Researchers found a gene mutation 200,000 to 100,000 years ago.  
This mutation links to speaking.  
It links to how the brain controls our mouth and face.  
Monkeys have a similar gene.  
But they do not have this mutation.  
We do not know how much genes affect language yet.  
One day we might find the answers in our DNA.  

Genes are parts of our body that carry traits.  
Language is a system of words we use to talk.

best_attempt.text_translated:
More questions lie in looking at the influence of genetics on brain and language development.  
Are there genes that changed and gave us language ability?  
Researchers found a change in a gene between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago.  
This change seems to have a connection with speaking.  
It seems to have a connection with how our brain controls our mouth and face.  
Monkeys have a similar gene, but they did not have this change.  
We do not know how much influence genetics have on language.  
One day we might find the answers in our DNA.
